title:
Dragon's Dogma 2 Mod, HDR, Ultrawide (21:9), Super Ultrawide (32:9), AMD 
FSR 3 & DLSS Support Details
text: Dragon’s Dogma was a hit and to follow up on its success, we have Dragon’s Dogma 2, which is just a couple of days from release. As fans are looking forward to playing the game on release day, many like yourself are curious about how they can enhance their gaming experience. They want to know about mods, HDR support, and whether the game will work well on ultrawide and super ultrawide monitors. They’re also interested in understanding if Dragon’s Dogma 2 will benefit from technologies like AMD FSR 3 and NVIDIA DLSS. Those are a lot of queries but don’t worry; we have got you covered. Players want these features in their games because they make the game better. Mods add new stuff or change things in the game to suit players’ tastes. HDR makes the colors pop and makes the game look more real. Ultrawide and super-ultrawide support lets players see more of the game world at once. AMD FSR 3 and NVIDIA DLSS make games run smoother and look better, even on weaker computers. Overall, these features make games more fun and immersive, which is why players are excited to have them in Dragon’s Dogma 2 and other games.  When it comes to mods, there’s no official confirmation yet. But Dragon’s Dogma 2 runs on the RE Engine, which is mod-friendly. This means that even without official modding tools or support, players can expect a vibrant modding scene. Just take a look at other games like Monster Hunter Rise, Street Fighter 6, and Resident Evil Remakes, which all run on the same engine and have active modding communities. Popular games often end up receiving a variety of mods. And, if you take a look at the game’s Nexus Mods page, you will find a bunch of mods available for it. So, yes, you can use mods in Dragon’s Dogma 2. Rumors have been circulating regarding Dragon’s Dogma 2’s support for ultrawide displays, which stems from the fact that Dragon’s Dogma 1 did have Ultrawide Support. It’s also reassuring to hear that the character creation demo for Dragon’s Dogma 2 already supports ultrawide monitors. (3440 x 1440). This suggests that the full game will likely offer support for players with ultrawide setups right from the start. However, there’s uncertainty surrounding support for super-ultrawide monitors. As of now, there’s been no official confirmation or information on this matter. Players will have to wait for the game’s official release to get more concrete confirmation on the extent of ultrawide monitor support. The announcement of DLSS 3 compatibility for Dragon’s Dogma 2 happened a while ago. Well, the game has support for DLSS, offering improved performance and image quality. FSR 3 is also available in the game, but there is a slight caveat. While DLSS comes with all its upscaling and frame-generating capabilities, players have noticed that the FSR 3 option is only limited to working as a graphics upscaler with no frame generation whatsoever. Dragon’s Dogma 2 also has native HDR support! You will see vibrant colors and enhanced visual fidelity if you have HDR-compatible displays. The inclusion of Dragon’s Dogma 2 in a Steam curator’s catalog of HDR games, with a mention of native HDR support, further confirms the game’s aim to deliver a visually stunning experience for players with HDR-enabled setups. As of now, this is all the information available regarding Dragon’s Dogma 2 and its features, such as mod and HDR support and ultrawide support, along with DLSS and FSR 3.
